The whole Nokia using Windows Phone 7 rumor thing reminds me a lot of how fact follows fiction. Back in 2003-2007, people constantly talked about Apple creating a mobile phone. People were always creating fake mock-ups and pretending they might be real someday.

(**** END****) Internet_News_|_ Google_Announces_Third_Quarter_2010_Financial_Results Giving us up to date insights into the way Google works and their intentions for the near term future, Eric Schmidt , CEO of Google said: Google had an excellent quarter, our core business grew very well, and our newer businesses-- particularly display and mobile-- continued to show significant momentum. Going forward, we remain committed to aggressive investment in both our people and our products as we pursue an innovation agenda. Announcing financial results for the quarter ended September 30, 2010. Google reported revenues of$ 7.29 billion for the quarter ended September 30, 2010, an increase of 23% compared to the third quarter of 2009
